definition: delivery room (in hospital)/labor ward
to give birth/to reproduce/to produce/product/resource/estate/property
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
surname Fang

sentences.english: Appropriately, Maternity Bend follows Hospital Bridge. This too was named after a medical facility – Macau's Maternity Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 山頂醫院天橋之後是產房彎，以澳門的婦產醫院命名。

sentences.english: These beetles make sausage-shaped brood chambers along the tunnels.
sentences.chinese: 這些甲蟲順着地道建造香腸形狀的產房。

sentences.english: CONCLUSION It is feasible to carry out the strict management of nosocomial infection in LDR.
sentences.chinese: 結論在家庭化產房實施嚴格的醫院感染管理是可行的。

sentences.english: She was confined on the twentieth and the baby was born on the twenty-first.
sentences.chinese: 她二十日進產房準備分娩，二十一日嬰兒就出生了。

sentences.english: It is also a common anaesthetic, used by dentists and in maternity wards.
sentences.chinese: 它也是牙醫和產房使用的一種常見麻醉劑。

sentences.english: But now it seems that so many people are crowding into the delivery suite you could almost sell tickets.
sentences.chinese: 而現在似乎太多的人湧進產房，都快可以收門票了。

definition: to bear and raise children
at childbirth/in labor
woman recuperating after childbirth/woman in childbirth
a mom (mother of a young child)
to face childbirth/about to give birth/refers esp. to the onset of regular contractions
to tidy up (dialect)
department of gynecology and obstetrics/birth clinic
two simultaneous happy events in the family
dubious or hard-to-treat cases (medicine)/hard cases
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to give birth without complications/easy childbirth/safe delivery/natural birth (without surgical operation)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
second child/second baby
to lie in bed/bedridden/bed
test tube baby
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
